title: All of my hard work. GONE.
body:
So yesterday I tried to go online at my local Starbucks after work so I could practice with my team. Upon trying to login however, I discovered I had been suspended for 2 weeks. Turns out Riot is accusing me of MMR Boosting. Im in silver 5 currently, but I seeded into bronze 4 at the beginning of the season and it has been a TRIAL to move up out of the darkest depths of "elo-hell". I've moved from Maryland to Florida, back to Maryland, and now am in Washington state. I travel a bit but what in the world would make them think i was boosting my MMR? 

If i was boosting wouldnt i be in gold? lol not silver 5... but what aggravates me the most is this. They are taking ALL OF MY REWARDS FROM ANY SEASON. EVER. I made this account in season 1 and have never been above silver 3. I am devastated. I spend a LOT of time on this game and have grown considerably as a player. but boosting? no. i did it MYSELF. and now it means nothing?

replies.body:
Hey Nazarith -

I appreciate your concern with ensuring that our detection is accurate and only catching those that should be detected for elo boosting. As such, when we receive disputes, we investigate each case just to make sure we didn't miss anything while configuring it for detection; it's totally possible we could have, so we want to check the integrity of the system by reviewing cases. 

For your particular case, your boosting happened early on in the season and had nothing to do with travel between Maryland and Florida. Looks like you made some quick trips to Canada and back though, within ~20 minutes.

Please keep in mind that even sharing your account with a friend  or even a family member is still account sharing and that any behavior that is found on the account while the sharing takes place, is ultimately the responsibility of the account owner.

☐ Not REKT 
☑ REKT 
☑ REKTangle 
☑ SHREKT 
☑ REKT-it Ralph 
☑ Total REKTall 
☑ The Lord of the REKT 
☑ The Usual SusREKTs 
☑ North by NorthREKT 
☑ REKT to the Future 
☑ Once Upon a Time in the REKT 
☑ The Good, the Bad, and the REKT 
☑ LawREKT of Arabia 
☑ Tyrannosaurus REKT 
☑ eREKTile dysfunction

Yeah so turns out my friend who lives in Canada was on my account. I'm not sure for how long but the fact it showed me traveling between the two within 20 minutes triggered a red flag. I did travel and play there on his computer, but that was ME, not him. He got on after I left in an attempt to "help" me since I seeded so low...

Moral of this story: change your passwords kids, and dont use the same password for everything... So I take back the negative things I said and will be deleting those comments. Thanks Riot Cluvie for giving me this extra information. 

PS. While I am aware i will not be eligible for THIS seasons rewards. but as for my bronze rewards from season 2 and my silver rewards for seasons 3&4, could i be able to keep those if for nothing else but nostalgia?

They're taking a zero tolerance stance on this it seems like. As long as you look guilty its good enough for a ban and a strike on your record. They don't want to be lenient on people regardless of rank because at this point Riot is treating the game as an esport and that everyone is a professional player. "Spirit" of the game or not, there are far worse offenders and there are probably plenty of real boosted player that are still out there trying to weasel themselves into the highest of ranks just for the sake of having challenger rank. The idea that riot could be slightly reasonable about this is a pipe dream and they couldn't care less. I don't think I can view riot the same way while they let people say some of the most malicious things and give them a slap on the wrist. Quite frankly I can't view league the same way or even want to give them my money anymore after spending 100s of dollars only to be treated like the worst criminal for an act that I was accused of without the evidence being presented to me. Instead I have to go out of my way to go on the forums to have the evidence presented to the public and people actively humiliating you on the sole basis that you look guilty even if it may not even be the case. This is not only a failure on the support clearing up any misunderstanding, but a lack of clarity on the why a punishment is handed out in the first place.

My case isn't like that, I was over a friend's house and he was coaching me on champs I normally don't play. I changed my password on my laptop remotely (because screw me for wanting to change my password as a slow typer not wanting to reveal a password that I uses for all my accounts). We hung out for a day or two and while I was hanging out with him, he coached me in ranked games with champs I normally don't play. I had a phone call that had sent me on tilt, picked a few different champs then went on a loosing streak but managed to get back on somewhat of a winning streak when he coached me again. At no point had anyone other than me been on my account.

I got somewhat of an interest in this.

As I frequent the noob chatroom I've sometimes seen people post their log in credentials, now if I log in have a look at the account and see the champions/whatnot it have, can I get into trouble?

Now if I report it, could you ban the account until the real owner shows up and verify his authenticity?

It's best not to use someone else's credentials to log into his/her account. If you see a summoner posting his/her account information, I would recommend messaging that individual and informing him/her account safe account practices, namely not posting account information; furthermore, I would recommend to the individual to change any account information immediately. 

If the summoner is ultimately unresponsive, perhaps report it to Riot Games Player Support. But again, to emphasize, don't be logging into other people's accounts!

You'd be surprised what kind of sticky situations I've come across.

Please don't get me wrong, I'm not asking because I like to go around logging into people's account and messing with their stuff, but I've actually come across situations where people post their log in credentials but just the user/pass combination without explaining what it is, which means that there's probably not a lot of people who realize what it is, and before I go around wasting supports time on a maybe, I need to actually verify that it is worth their time.

That is just one scenario.

For instance when it comes to scammers/phishers I'm in the high hundreds, and sending them in one by one is a complete waste of supports time. (which is why I never send in less than 10 at a time) 
I am just the kind of person who prefer to do the legwork before contacting support.

Yeah, I understand, but for your own sake, I would still not recommend logging into another summoner's account. You wouldn't want your account/IP being connected to a compromised account. I would say, let the fraud department take care of the issue from there.
I would love to talk to you about some of my dilemma's considering the circumstances, but I can't exactly discuss these things in public.
{{summoner:11}} {{summoner:11}}
bump for you... Hope riot sees this and fixes your problem man.
thank you very much, i have a ticket with them and theyre going to investigate the issue further. i appreciate the support :)

Upvoted so Riot sees, I got the same ban and my account is mine and not boosted.  

Did Riot support actually reply back and said they were going to investigate? 

I made a post and also submitted a report. Unfortunately Riot support was completely unhelpful and gave me a response 3 days later that was exactly what the first email said:

"Your suspension was only issued after an extensive investigation was run to ensure your involvement in MMR boosting. As explained in the email you received in response to your suspension, the following actions have been taken on your account:

-A two-week suspension has been issued to your account.
-All previous Season rewards (Victorious skins, borders, season icons, season ward skins) have been stripped from your account.
-You are ineligible for any 2015 Season rewards

While you may feel that this punishment is too harsh, please realize that having accounts boosted, for whatever reason, ruins the spirit of League of Legends competitive play. While you are ineligible for any rewards in the 2015 Season, this does not disqualify you for anything pertaining to the 2016 Season. Keep in mind that if you have any future involvement in MMR boosting, your account will be permanently suspended."

they said they would investigate further and said it might take a couple of days and then turned around a few hours later to tell me that they had indeed deemed that another player was playing ranked games on my account.... so everything ive worked for even BEFORE this season is going to be gone. im so done.

You are not the only one. It took me nearly a month to go from silver 3 to gold 5 on season 4, and on season 5 took me like a week to finish my placements, and still ended up in gold again, even tho my performance wasnt really good (I main mid/sup/adc lanes, but played some jungle, and ended up with an average of around 40-50 creeps per game). What booster would actually take nearly a month to boost 4 ranks?

But riot wont listen to anything now. I've sent them graphs with my games, how long I took to actually get promoted... Even compared it with a smurf account I have on another server. I mean, I got out of bronze with the smurf, series to silver 4, and hopefully going up to gold, and I play on that account like, 2 or 3 games per week. On that smurf I'm playing against gold players, even played against a gold 2. The average MMR per match is 1360. I finished season 4 on my main account with an mmr of 1500.

I think they believe I boosted because I played a different lane and won the match (even with a bad performance and being carried) and ended up on gold 1 after the series. I mean, seriously, take a look at the attached picture, look at the performance, look at the creeps and k/d, and the system still sent me to gold 1 with that, and now claiming I boosted with a bad performance like that.

BTW, my placement history on the last 3 seasons were : S3 - 7/3 , S4 7/3 , S5 8/2

obviously this is an issue with multiple people, and so it ends up being a customer service issue... but what is a drop in a bucket compared to all the people who play this game? im surprised they even care about bronze/silver... if it was gold i would understand.

I know what you mean about the bronze/silver thingy. I was actually surprised about my placement aswell. As you can see on that screenshot, it was an average to low performance. I actually did way better on the other seasons. But then you work for about a month on your gaming to get up like 2 or 3 ranks, then get suspended and see all your work thrown away as it was nothing. This is upsetting.


They should just fix the ranking system and prevent people of going to ranks way too high like that. I played an average match and now paying the price for that, as if i was boosted.
It's an algorithm, they said so themselves. Riot is literally automating the whole punishment process taking the human thought out of the whole process and Riot takes pride in this.

It seems as though a lot of people are being banned over some misunderstandings. They seem to be handing out mmr boosting bans without much explanation as to why they are handing out these bans either.

> [{quoted}](name=Syrax,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=00080001,timestamp=2015-08-04T19:04:45.012+0000)
>
>  The fact that I got a false-positive in the first place when I did nothing, shakes their credibility in my eyes. 

Like I said.  The system has a threshold and parameters.  Innocent or not, if your account reaches those parameters then it's going to hit on their system.


> [{quoted}](name=Syrax,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=00080001,timestamp=2015-08-04T19:04:45.012+0000)
>
> In the email they sent (which mind you I had to ask for) stated "After an extensive investigation", meaning the investigation already concluded and they confirmed that I am, in fact, an elo booster once already.

The emails they send are generally auto generated.  Yes you have to ask for it because like I said people who are knowingly in the wrong will rarely make a fuss about it.  It'll be a "Shit I got caught."  They might try to email to weasle their way out, which is why there are automated emails.

Continue to raise a fuss and you'll get to real people who you'll talk to directly.

All systems have flaws.  None are going to be perfect.

Don't you know they want to keep people who are in bronze down in bronze?  That helps them promote the game with their pro players.  Us peons don't get any attention, even if we HAVE SPENT $500 ON THIS DAMN GAME!

> [{quoted}](name=Nazarith,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-04T02:02:53.118+0000)
>
> they said they would investigate further and said it might take a couple of days and then turned around a few hours later to tell me that they had indeed deemed that another player was playing ranked games on my account.... so everything ive worked for even BEFORE this season is going to be gone. im so done.

Not necessarily true.  When the investigation concludes, they'll reverse the 'punishment'.

> [{quoted}](name=Nazarith,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=00030000000000000000,timestamp=2015-08-04T02:04:23.575+0000)
>
> i used to always defend riot when people bad mouth them but no longer, this is ridiculous. i will never buy another skin and i will NOT pay for any service from them ever again. i might love the game, but the company behind it has lost my respect and will get no more of my money.

> [{quoted}](name=Deadly Gale,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-08-04T03:17:58.480+0000)
>
> It's an algorithm, they said so themselves. Riot is literally automating the whole punishment process taking the human thought out of the whole process and Riot takes pride in this.

You have to understand this from a development standpoint.  What they were doing was taking it case by case.  Boosters were getting punished when they go reported or were going over board with it.  Their player base has grown immensely that by automating it to find accounts within their typical banning parameter made it more feasible for them as a company to manage.   It doesn't matter how much man power you dump into it, a computer will always be faster and more accurate.  Human thought is put into the parameters.  It's not like the machine chose the threshold to choose when to punish and not.  That was programmed by a human who was given a lot of data that in a nut shell said "This is when we determine an account gets banned."

Automating it let the system find accounts that were boosting, but not reported.  If someone was really boosting, they know it and probably wouldn't risk saying they were innocent.  It went from a reporting system with less scope to more scope, so more players are going to get affected.  Because of this there will be more false positives.  Meaning there will be hits on accounts that hit the 'ban threshold', but really are innocent and need a human to make an exception.  It's easier to manage the false positives on a high scope system compared to manually managing all the true positives on a low scope system.

> [{quoted}](name=Syrax,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2015-08-04T07:41:40.596+0000)
>
> Same problem here. Banned for elo boosting what a joke. Just because I duo climbed from S1 to G5 in a day doesn't mean I was elo boosting. Every time I see another post like this, I get even more frustrated. I keep reading how they keep sending the same copy-pasted message of how they did a extensive investigation, which seems like its just some poorly programmed bot giving these bans out. No one is even reviewing our cases, this is so unfair for someone that followed the summoner's code strictly. Being falsely accused of something is bad enough but they won't even let us know why they think we are elo boosting. Without that information we cannot refute their claim, we are just judged as guilty with no proof of a so-called "investigation".

Where it's true, and I'm not denying, people are getting banned for not actually breaking any rules, but it is a bot doing it.  When an account hits a 'ban threshold', the system finds it and locks it.  They tell you ban, but what's really happening is it's the equivalent of being detained or held in contempt. You're still innocent, which is why there is still an investigation that needs to be done, but they have enough evidence to hold you accountable for the actions found until the time comes to pass judgement.  This 'hold' on your account can be lifted with ease by Riot so long as your case is deemed a false positive and you're innocent.  If you weren't then case closed and the hold because a sentence if you will which is the true ban.

> [{quoted}](name=Civansky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-08-04T04:06:30.361+0000)
>
> Don't you know they want to keep people who are in bronze down in bronze?  That helps them promote the game with their pro players.  Us peons don't get any attention, even if we HAVE SPENT $500 ON THIS DAMN GAME!

They do give too much attention to the pro league.  I feel like they balance the game around a select few players, which isn't really fair, but this is conspiracy on a whole other level.

Just because you spend money doesn't mean you deserve an increase in a league.

Study a martial arts.  If you pay extra money to get 'bumped to the next belt' doesn't actually make you any better.

> [{quoted}](name=Bunny Bells,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-08-04T17:26:53.265+0000)
> 
> Where it's true, and I'm not denying, people are getting banned for not actually breaking any rules, but it is a bot doing it.  When an account hits a 'ban threshold', the system finds it and locks it.  They tell you ban, but what's really happening is it's the equivalent of being detained or held in contempt. You're still innocent, which is why there is still an investigation that needs to be done, but they have enough evidence to hold you accountable for the actions found until the time comes to pass judgement.  This 'hold' on your account can be lifted with ease by Riot so long as your case is deemed a false positive and you're innocent.  If you weren't then case closed and the hold because a sentence if you will which is the true ban.

What you said would be true only if I had faith in riot to fix this. Which at this point, I do not. The fact that I got a false-positive in the first place when I did nothing, shakes their credibility in my eyes. In the email they sent (which mind you I had to ask for) stated "After an extensive investigation", meaning the investigation already concluded and they confirmed that I am, in fact, an elo booster once already. Why would I expect them to figure out that I am a false positive, when they already falsely judged me once already without any new evidence? Keep in mind I can't even provide them with new evidence when they won't even tell me why they think I am in a elo booster in the first place, I have no idea what they are even referring to. This looks like this process is just going to go in a complete circle, they are going to say they have evidence, I am going to ask what evidence do you have , they will NOT reveal what evidence they have and eventually they are just going to close the case (making this assumption based on what I have seen on these forums in the last couple of days).

> [{quoted}](name=Bunny Bells,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2015-08-04T17:26:53.265+0000)
>
>
> 
> a computer will always be faster and more accurate.  Human thought is put into the parameters.  It's not like the machine chose the threshold to choose when to punish and not.  That was programmed by a human who was given a lot of data that in a nut shell said "This is when we determine an account gets banned."

Gotta disagree a little bit with that. Take a look at my case for example. I play mostly on my main account (this one, that got suspended), but I have another account on another server. On this smurf account, I play a variety of champs on ranked, I try to practice with them on this smurf before playing them on my main. Janna, for example, I had 32 ranked matches with her on my smurf, 18 w - 14 l , after I was confident enough with her, I played her on my main. Another example is Alistar, play him alot on my smurf account, but none on my main. Brand, 6 games, 5 w - 1 l , yet again never played him on this Main account. I only play on my main ranked acc champs I have a little bit of confidence with, or champs I know how they work. Yet the computer deemed my account boosted due this "irregular" champ pick. Or maybe because the ranking system placed me way higher than what I used to be after the placements, forcing me to stop playing ranked because I couldnt keep it up with the plats

And the smurf is S5, about to go to S4, earning about 28 lp per win and 12 lp per loss and playing against G5-G2 players, so that means the elo of the account is higher than the tier im in, and its not higher because I play very few games on it, compared with the main. On my main I was G5 last season, earning 15 per win and about the same per loss. 

> Just because you spend money doesn't mean you deserve an increase in a league.

I totally agree with that. Pay 2 Win isnt really fair.

> [{quoted}](name=Draklain,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=bedNZrhg,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2015-08-04T18:37:23.553+0000)
>
> Gotta disagree a little bit with that. Take a look at my case for example. I play mostly on my main account (this one, that got suspended), but I have another account on another server. On this smurf account, I play a variety of champs on ranked, I try to practice with them on this smurf before playing them on my main. Janna, for example, I had 32 ranked matches with her on my smurf, 18 w - 14 l , after I was confident enough with her, I played her on my main. Another example is Alistar, play him alot on my smurf account, but none on my main. Brand, 6 games, 5 w - 1 l , yet again never played him on this Main account. I only play on my main ranked acc champs I have a little bit of confidence with, or champs I know how they work. Yet the computer deemed my account boosted due this "irregular" champ pick. Or maybe because the ranking system placed me way higher than what I used to be after the placements, forcing me to stop playing ranked because I couldnt keep it up with the plats
> 
> And the smurf is S5, about to go to S4, earning about 28 lp per win and 12 lp per loss and playing against G5-G2 players, so that means the elo of the account is higher than the tier im in, and its not higher because I play very few games on it, compared with the main. On my main I was G5 last season, earning 15 per win and about the same per loss. 
> 
> I totally agree with that. Pay 2 Win isnt really fair.

I can't speak for Riot, I can only speak from what I see and observer.

I don't believe a parameter would be checking for "irregular champ picks".  It may possibly be seeing a spike in performance with said champ that is irregular.  However that is just one of the risks you play with when playing on a smurf like that.  Not saying it's bad, but it can show a variable difference in play style which might trigger it.  Again, I would assume Riot would be able to investigate this and deem it accordingly.

Same problem here. Banned for elo boosting what a joke. Just because I duo climbed from S1 to G5 in a day doesn't mean I was elo boosting. Every time I see another post like this, I get even more frustrated. I keep reading how they keep sending the same copy-pasted message of how they did a extensive investigation, which seems like its just some poorly programmed bot giving these bans out. No one is even reviewing our cases, this is so unfair for someone that followed the summoner's code strictly. Being falsely accused of something is bad enough but they won't even let us know why they think we are elo boosting. Without that information we cannot refute their claim, we are just judged as guilty with no proof of a so-called "investigation".

This is what we call a false positive.  If you truly haven't been MMR boosting then you'll be fine.  The system caught it because of the multiple IP changes coming from your account.

Submit a support ticket, and explain the situation.  Riot isn't heartless, I'm sure they will understand.
What would i file it under? I filed a ticket initially to find out why i was suspended but all they did was elaborate on the email i received and tell me the why.
Hahaha, get wrecked, cheater.
sucks to suck booster!
